dialogue.text: 「No. Nor have they usually got red hair or that number of pustules.」
「Ron, it's not a ghoul. It's a disguised Death Eater! We need to get under here quickly before they spot us. Come on!」
「What d’you think I’ve been trying to do, Harry?」
「I know, Hermione, I know. We have to find him before something terrible happens.」

「Ah, sir, ask no more, ask no more of poor Dobby. Dark deeds are planned in this place, but Harry Potter must not be here when they happen — go home, Harry Potter, go home. Harry Potter must not meddle in this, sir, ’tis too dangerous —」

「I'm not going anywhere, Dobby. I can't just leave my friends and let these dark deeds unfold without trying to stop them. I may not be the brightest or the most skilled, but I have to do what I can to protect those I care about.」
「Dobby can’t, sir, Dobby can’t, Dobby mustn’t tell! Go home, Harry Potter, go home!」

「Dobby, I appreciate your concern, but I can't just go home. There's something going on at Hogwarts, and I need to find out what it is. I won't let my friends or anyone else be in danger. Please, if you know anything, you have to tell me.」
「Ron, Ginny! Oh, and Harry dear — how are you?」
Oh, Mrs. Weasley, I'm doing alright, thank you. Just trying to stay focused and prepare for the challenges ahead. How about you? How's everything going with the Order of the Phoenix?
「Finest dragon skin, little bro. Business is booming and we thought we’d treat ourselves.」
「Hello, I didn’t expect... what are you all doing here?」
「all the tasks he had to get through in the Triwizard Tournament last year — getting past dragons and merpeople and acromantulas and things . . .」
「Look, I . . . I don’t want to sound like I’m trying to be modest or anything, but . . . I had a lot of help with all that stuff . . .」
「That was a seriously cool bit of flying . . .」

"Yeah, well, I've had my fair share of practice. Quidditch has taught me a thing or two about flying. But it's not just about the flying skills, you know. It's about strategy, teamwork, and keeping a sharp eye on the Snitch. It's a thrilling sport, really."
「You’ve got a Firebolt!」
「Yeah, I know, it's amazing! But what about you, Ron? Did you make the Quidditch team?」
「S’all dark, Harry, What’re you on about?」
「I mean, there's a light coming from Hagrid's cabin. Don't you think it's strange? We should go check it out.」
「I mean, it was really great of you and everything, Everyone thought it was a wonderful thing to do —」
「That’s funny, because I definitely remember Ron saying I’d wasted time acting the hero. . . . Is that what you think this is? You reckon I want to act the hero again?」
「No, no, no! That’s not what I mean at all!」
「Then what do you mean, Hermione? Spit it out!」
「For heaven’s sake, Harry, Go and find Justin if it’s so important to you.」
"I'm sorry, Hermione, but I can't just ignore this. Justin might be in danger, and I have to make sure he's alright. I'll catch up with you later, okay?"
「Ignore it, Just ignore it, Harry.」
「I can't ignore it, Hermione! I need to know what happened.」
「I don’t hate her, I just think she’s an absolutely appalling teacher and a real old fraud. . . . But Harry’s already missed History of Magic and I don’t think he ought to miss anything else today!」
「Thanks, Hermione. I appreciate your concern. But I think I'll manage. Missing a few classes won't be the end of the world. Besides, I have more important things to focus on right now.」
「Well, carry on! You know what to do! Or am I such a substandard teacher that you have never learned how to open a book?」

*sighs* "No, Professor Trelawney, it's not that. It's just that sometimes the answers we seek can't be found in books. Divination is a complex and intuitive art, and it requires more than just reading words on a page. It's about tapping into our inner senses and trusting our instincts. So, if you'll allow me, I'll continue to explore this subject in my own way."

「The establishment! Yes, those with eyes too clouded by the Mundane to See as I See, to Know as I Know . . . Of course, we Seers have always been feared, always persecuted. . . . It is — alas — our fate . . .」

「I understand that you feel misunderstood and persecuted, Professor Trelawney. It must be difficult to possess such unique abilities. However, I believe it's important to approach divination with an open mind and a critical eye. It's crucial to separate genuine insights from mere coincidences or vague predictions.」
「Let’s just keep moving, shall we?」
「Yeah, you're right. We can't let this distract us from our mission. Let's focus on finding the Horcruxes and defeating Voldemort. We'll deal with Malfoy and his taunts later.」
「Hermione glance edgily at Hermione」
「Oh, right. Sorry, I forgot about the password change. Hermione, do you happen to know the new one?」
「You think you know more magic than I do? Than I, than Lord Voldemort, who has performed magic that Dumbledore himself never dreamed of?」
「Oh, he dreamed of it, but he knew more than you, knew enough not to do what you’ve done.」
「You mean he was weak! Too weak to dare, too weak to take what might have been his, what will be mine!」

「No, he was not weak. He was wise. He knew that power does not come from conquering others, but from conquering oneself. He chose not to seek power for power's sake, but to protect and guide others. That is true strength, Voldemort, something you will never understand.」
「Dumbledore is dead! His body decays in the marble tomb in the grounds of this castle, I have seen it, Potter, and he will not return!」
「Yes, Dumbledore’s dead, but you didn’t have him killed. He chose his own manner of dying, chose it months before he died, arranged the whole thing with the man you thought was your servant.」
「Voldemort They continued to circle each other like wolves about to tear each other apart.」

「That, Professor, is the part of Voldemort that he never understood. He underestimated the power of love. It's the reason why he could never truly defeat me. Love protected me, and it protected those I cared about. It's what kept me going, even in the face of death.」
「Because you’re not of age and you haven’t passed your test,」
「You have to pass a test to Apparate?」

「The Department of Magical Transportation had to fine a couple of people the other day for Apparating without a license. It’s not easy, Apparition, and when it’s not done properly it can lead to nasty complications. This pair I’m talking about went and Splinched themselves.」
「Er — Splinched?」
「Oh yes,」
「But Bill and Charlie and Percy can all do it?」
「Oh yes,」
「I'm Harry, Harry Potter.」
「said "I’m his Head of House, and I shall decide how hard, or otherwise, to be. Follow me, Draco."」
「Wait, Professor Snape! I need to talk to you about something important. It's about Draco and his mission from Voldemort. I think he's in real danger.」
「Do you think this mirror shows the future?」

"I don't think so, Ron. The Mirror of Erised shows us our deepest desires, not the future. It reveals what our hearts truly long for. It's a powerful and enchanting object, but it doesn't possess the ability to predict what lies ahead."
「Want to play chess, Harry?」
"Sure, Ron! I could use a good game of chess to take my mind off things. Let's set up the board."
「I know what you’re thinking about, Harry, that mirror. Don’t go back tonight.」
「Why not?」
「I’m serious, Harry, don’t go.」
「I have to, Ron. You know I can't just sit back and do nothing.」
「So, you, like hundreds before you, have discovered the delights of the Mirror of Erised.」
「I didn’t know it was called that, sir.」
「And it showed your friend Ron himself as Head Boy.」
「Really?」
「It was on my birthday! I was looking forward to that!」
「Not a big surprise, though, is it? Not after what happened to Katie.」
「But now all I’ve got to look forward to is stupid Apparition! Big birthday treat . . .」
「Happy birthday, Ron. Have a present.」
「Want one?」
「No, I'm good, thanks.」
「I’m not hungry.」
「Are you sure you're okay, Ron? You don't seem like yourself.」
「It’s not that, You . . . you wouldn’t understand.」
「Ron, I may not understand completely, but I'm your friend. You can talk to me about anything. What's bothering you?」
「I don’t think she knows I exist, She definitely knows you exist, She keeps snogging you, doesn’t she?」
「Who are you talking about? Who are you talking about?」
「You insulted her, Harry! You said it was a joke!」
「I didn't mean to insult her, Ron. It was just a misunderstanding. I never intended to hurt her feelings.」
「Thanks, Erm — Harry — could I borrow Hedwig so I can tell Mum and Dad? They’ll be really pleased — I mean, prefect is something they can understand —」
「Yeah, no problem, Take her!」
「Harry had not asked Dumbledore to give him the prefect badge. This was not Ron’s fault」
「No, Ron, it's not your fault either. None of us could have predicted this. We're in this together, remember? We'll figure it out.」

「Harry think "Harry thoroughly enjoyed double Divination that afternoon; they were still doing star charts and predictions, but now that he and Ron were friends once more, the whole thing seemed very funny again. Professor Trelawney, who had been so pleased with the pair of them when they had been predicting their own horrific deaths, quickly became irritated as they sniggered through her explanation of the various ways in which Pluto could disrupt everyday life. “I would think,” she said, in a mystical whisper that did not conceal her obvious annoyance, “that some of us” — she stared very meaningfully at Harry — “might be a little less frivolous had they seen what I have seen during my crystal gazing last night. As I sat here, absorbed in my needlework, the urge to consult the orb overpowered me. I arose, I settled myself before it, and I gazed into its crystalline depths . . . and what do you think I saw gazing back at me?” “An ugly old bat in outsize specs?” Ron muttered under his breath. Harry fought hard to keep his face straight. “Death, my dears.” Parvati and Lavender both put their hands over their mouths, looking horrified. “Yes,” said Professor Trelawney, nodding impressively, “it comes, ever closer, it circles overhead like a vulture, ever lower . . . ever lower over the castle. . . .” She stared pointedly at Harry, who yawned very widely and obviously. “It’d be a bit more impressive if she hadn’t done it about eighty times before,” Harry said as they finally regained the fresh air of the staircase beneath Professor Trelawney’s room. “But if I’d dropped dead every time she’s told me I’m going to, I’d be a medical miracle.” “You’d be a sort of extra-concentrated ghost,” said Ron, chortling, as they passed the Bloody Baron going in the opposite direction, his wide eyes staring sinisterly. “At least we didn’t get homework. I hope Hermione got loads off Professor Vector, I love not working when she is. . . .” But Hermione wasn’t at dinner, nor was she in the library when they went to look for her afterward. The only person in there was Viktor Krum. Ron hovered behind the bookshelves for a while, watching Krum, debating in whispers with Harry whether he should ask for an autograph — but then Ron realized that six or seven girls were lurking in the next row of books, debating exactly the same thing, and he lost his enthusiasm for the idea. “Wonder where she’s got to?” Ron said as he and Harry went back to Gryffindor Tower. “Dunno . . . balderdash.” But the Fat Lady had barely begun to swing forward when the sound of racing feet behind them announced Hermione’s arrival. “Harry!” she panted, skidding to a halt beside him (the Fat Lady stared down at her, eyebrows raised). “Harry, you’ve got to come — you’ve got to come, the most amazing thing’s happened — please —” She seized Harry’s arm and started to try to drag him back along the corridor. “What’s the matter?” Harry said. “I’ll show you when we get there — oh come on, quick —” Harry looked around at Ron; he looked back at Harry, intrigued."」
"Alright, Hermione, calm down. What's happened? Is it something serious?"
「What did he catch the Snitch for? He ended it when Ireland were a hundred and sixty points ahead, the idiot!」
He knew they were never going to catch up! The Irish Chasers were too good. He wanted to end it on his terms, that’s all.
「Cho looked disappointed」

"Well, Cho, I reckon we should stick together and figure out a plan. We can't let disappointment get the best of us. Let's gather our friends and come up with a strategy to tackle whatever challenges lie ahead."

「Over here. It comes out somewhere different every day, so they’ve never been able to find it. Only trouble is, we never know exactly where we’re going to end up when we go out. Be careful, Harry, they’re always patrolling the corridors at night.」
「No problem. See you in a bit.」
「We’re up on the fifth floor,」

「Gold, I expect, Malfoy’s been giving generously to all sorts of things for years, Gets him in with the right people, then he can ask favors, delay laws he doesn’t want passed, Oh, he’s very well connected, Lucius Malfoy.」
「Mr. Weasley, if Fudge is meeting Death Eaters like Malfoy, if he’s seeing them alone, how do we know they haven’t put the Imperius Curse on him?」

「Don’t think it hadn’t occurred to us, Harry. But Dumbledore thinks Fudge is acting of his own accord at the moment — which, as Dumbledore says, is not a lot of comfort. . . . Best not talk about it anymore just now, Harry . . .」
「Wait . . .Everyone seems quite relieved, though, considering they all knew I’d get off」

「Don’t think it hadn’t occurred to us, Harry, But Dumbledore thinks Fudge is acting of his own accord at the moment — which, as Dumbledore says, is not a lot of comfort. . . . Best not talk about it anymore just now, Harry . . .」

「Wait, Mr. Weasley. I understand that Dumbledore believes Fudge is acting independently, but we can't ignore the possibility that Fudge might be under the Imperius Curse. We need to be cautious and consider all possibilities.」
「“Oh, it would be lovely if they got married!” whispered Lily ecstatically. “Teddy would really be part of the family then!”」

"Yeah, it would be great if they got married. Teddy would truly become a part of our family. But let's not get ahead of ourselves, Mum. Let's just be happy for them and support them in whatever they decide."
「“Yeah!” said James enthusiastically. “I don’t mind sharing with Al — Teddy could have my room!”」
「No,” said Harry firmly, “you and Al will share a room only when I want the house demolished.”」
「James -」
"James? What are you talking about?"
「In that case, perhaps we can return to my list. I am in something of a hurry, Borgin, I have important business elsewhere today —」
"Oh, I'm sorry to interrupt your important business, Mr. Malfoy, but I couldn't help but notice your interest in Horcruxes. Care to share what you know about them?"
「Shame. I really fancied finding out what old Snape’s been up to.」

"Well, Fred, I can understand your curiosity. Snape has always been a mysterious and enigmatic character. But I must say, I've had my fair share of encounters with him, and they haven't always been pleasant. He's a complex individual, to say the least."

「Yeh know what I’d love, Harry? I’d love yeh ter win, I really would. It’d show ’em all . . . yeh don’ have ter be pureblood ter do it. Yeh don’ have ter be ashamed of what yeh are. It’d show ’em Dumbledore’s the one who’s got it righ’, lettin’ anyone in as long as they can do magic. How you doin’ with that egg, Harry?」

Well, Hagrid, I appreciate your support. Winning the tournament would indeed send a powerful message about acceptance and equality. As for the egg, I'm making progress. It's proving to be quite a challenge, but I'm determined to figure it out. Thanks for asking, Hagrid.
「Only because he was too stupid to listen to what Hagrid told him to do」

「You know, Umbridge, it takes a lot more than just intelligence to be a good person. Hagrid may not always make the wisest decisions, but he has a heart of gold and cares deeply for others. That's something you could never understand.」
「Crookshanks action」
"What's going on here? Why is Crookshanks acting so strange?"
「McGonagall would go nuts if she knew」
「Yeah, she would. But we can't let that stop us from figuring out what these things mean. We have to be careful and discreet.」
「Well, what else can I say?」
「You can say sorry,」
「I wanted to come back the minute I’d Disapparated, but I walked straight into a gang of Snatchers, Hermione, and I couldn’t go anywhere!」
「What did you say to them?」
「decided it must have shrunk in the wash」
「That's not what I meant! How come I received a Howler? Who sent it?」
「Dudley and Piers sniggered」
「“What’s so funny?”」
「“Good luck,” Ron muttered, climbing into the room as Harry crept out past him.」
「Thanks, Ron. I'll do my best. See you soon.」
「That’s what she did, did she? Idiotic woman. Never liked her.」
Sorry, Professor Slughorn, but I didn't like her either.
「Slughorn think "Don’t think I don’t know why he’s brought you."」
「I'm just going to the library, Hermione. I need to do some more research on Horcruxes. We need to find out everything we can about them if we want to defeat Voldemort.」

「Slughorn think "I was Head of Slytherin. Oh, now, don’t go holding that against me! You’ll be Gryffindor like her, I suppose? Yes, it usually goes in families. Not always, though. Ever heard of Sirius Black? You must have done — been in the papers for the last couple of years — died a few weeks ago —"」

「Well, anyway, he was a big pal of your father’s at school. The whole Black family had been in my House, but Sirius ended up in Gryffindor! Shame — he was a talented boy. I got his brother, Regulus, when he came along, but I’d have liked the set.」
「Slughorn think "Funny how that sometimes happens, isn’t it?"」
「Not really.Well, a few more accidents like that and the game’s in the bag, isn’t it?」
「How’re you feeling?」
*nervously* "He’s just nervous."
「He's just nervous, Ginny.Ha, ha.」
「Don’t you think it’s funny?」
「Ha, ha.And I think Harper of Slytherin’s seen the Snitch! Yes, he’s certainly seen something Potter hasn’t!Oi, Harper! How much did Malfoy pay you to come on instead of him?」
「Forgot to brake, Professor, sorry.」
「Party up in the common room, Seamus said! C’mon, Ginny, Demelza!」
「You know perfectly well what we’re talking about! You spiked Ron’s juice with lucky potion at breakfast! Felix Felicis!」
「No, I didn’t.Hagrid wasn’t talking about your singing. He was talking about my mum and dad dying.」
「I don’t — don’t suppose you remember it, Harry?」
「No — well, I was only one when they died. But I’ve found out pretty much what happened since. My dad died first. Did you know that?」
「Liked her? I don’t imagine anyone who met her wouldn’t have liked her. . . . Very brave . . . Very funny . . . It was the most horrible thing. . . .」
「But you won’t help her son. She gave me her life, but you won’t give me a memory.It can, Dumbledore needs information. I need information.Of course I am.」
「Well, as I’m not invited to any parties, I think I’ll go to bed.」

「Come on, Ron. Don't be like that. We can still have a good time together. Maybe we can practice some spells or play a game of wizard's chess. It doesn't matter if we're not invited to parties, we can make our own fun.」
「Right, Thanks a lot, Demelza.」
「No problem, Demelza. Good luck with your practice.」
「TROY SCORES! Ten zero to Ireland!」
"But Levski’s got the Quaffle!"
「House-elves! Not once, in over a thousand pages, does Hogwarts」

「Hermione, calm down. I understand your frustration, but let's not jump to conclusions. Accusing someone without evidence won't solve anything. We need to gather more information before making any assumptions about Draco Malfoy or his family.」
「She had to go to the hospital wing.」
「We’ll explain later. Pansy Parkinson was listening.」
「Harry and Ron action」
「Who's there?」
Harry and Ron action
「“Er — aren’t there — aren’t there supposed to be werewolves in the forest?”」
「There are good things in there, too. The centaurs are all right, and the unicorns . . .」
「Did I hear right? You’ve been taking orders from something someone wrote in a book, Harry?」
「It’s nothing. It’s not like, you know, Riddle’s diary. It’s just an old textbook someone’s scribbled on.」
「We ought to check that there’s nothing odd about it. I mean, all these funny instructions, who knows?」

「You're right, Hermione. Let's take a closer look and make sure there's nothing suspicious about it. We can't be too careful, especially with the history of strange occurrences we've encountered before.」
「It seems all right. I mean, it really does seem to be . . . just a textbook.」

「Yeah, I guess you're right. It's just a textbook with some extra notes. But there's something about it that feels different, you know? Like it's leading me down a path I can't quite see yet. I can't explain it, but I can't ignore it either.」
「Hermione was resolutely plowing on with what she called the “official” instructions, but becoming increasingly bad-tempered as they yielded poorer results than the Prince’s」
「Hermione, I appreciate your efforts with the official instructions, but maybe we should consider giving the Prince's instructions another try. They seemed to work better for us before.」
「Won’t make no diff’rence! Them Disposal devils, they’re all in Lucius Malfoy’s pocket! Scared o’ him! An’ if I lose the case, Buckbeak —」
「What about Dumbledore, Hagrid?」
「Ron and Hermione looked quickly at Harry, as though expecting him to start berating Hagrid for not telling him the truth about Black」
「No, it's not Hagrid's fault. He was just trying to protect me.」
「The prophecy, give me the prophecy, Potter!」
"Sorry, Lucius, but I think I'll be keeping the prophecy for now. It's not something I'm willing to hand over to someone like you."
「Harry struggled hard and viciously」
"Get off me! Get off!"
「Dey’re all back dere, A brain addacked Ron bud I dink he’s all righd — and Herbione’s unconscious, bud we could feel a bulse —」
「We need to get to them, Neville. We can't let them suffer.」
「Neville clambered out of the real tunnel, gave a roar of delight, leapt down from the mantelpiece」
"Neville, what's happened to you? How did you manage to find this incredible hideout? And more importantly, how did you escape the clutches of the Carrows?"
「asked if it's true that they broke into Gringotts and escaped on a dragon」
「Yeah, it’s true. But that’s not the point. Neville, we’re trying to find out what’s guarding the Sorcerer’s Stone at Hogwarts.」
「“Krum’s one decent player, Ireland has got seven,” said Charlie shortly. “I wish England had got through. That was embarrassing, that was.”」
"Yeah, it would have been great if England made it. But hey, let's not underestimate Ireland's team. They've got some impressive Chasers. It's going to be an exciting match, that's for sure."
「Don’t you think it’s funny?」

"Funny? No, Malfoy, I don't find your behavior amusing at all. Making fun of someone's appearance is petty and mean-spirited. It says a lot about your character, or rather, the lack thereof. I suggest you find something better to do with your time than belittle others."

「Speaking of dogs, did you know that Lucius Malfoy recognized you last time you risked a little jaunt outside? Clever idea, Black, getting yourself seen on a safe station platform . . . gave you a cast-iron excuse not to leave your hidey-hole in future, didn’t it?」

「Oh, I see. So you're here to gloat about it, Snape? Typical. Always ready to revel in someone else's misfortune. But let me tell you something, Malfoy recognizing Sirius was just a coincidence. We had our reasons for being there, and it had nothing to do with hiding. So why don't you go back to your dungeon and leave us alone?」
「Sirius roared, trying to push Harry out of the way」
「Sirius, no!」
Harry action
「Professor McGonagall looking at Ron and Harry, angry」

Professor McGonagall, I assure you, we had no intention of causing trouble. We were merely trying to protect Hermione from the troll. It was a split-second decision, and we acted out of concern for our friend's safety. We didn't have time to think about the consequences.
「Hermione Granger, telling a downright lie to a teacher?」
「Oh, shut up, Ron.」
「You realize she’s including Quidditch in this? We have to go and ask permission to re-form the Gryffindor team!」

"What? We have to ask permission to re-form the Gryffindor team? That's ridiculous! But we can't let Umbridge ruin Quidditch for us. We'll have to go and talk to her, even if it means swallowing our pride. Let's gather the team and go see her together."

「You read the sign, it mentions teams too! So listen, Harry . . . I am saying this for the last time. . . . Please, please don’t lose your temper with Umbridge again or she might not let us play anymore!」

「I know, Angelina, I know. I'll try my best to control my temper. It's just frustrating to see the injustice and unfairness happening. But I won't let it affect our chances of playing Quidditch. We'll find a way to make it work, I promise.」
「Well, the sword, Harry! Dumbledore must have known you’d want to go back there, and I mean, Godric’s Hollow is Godric Gryffindor’s birthplace —」

"Yeah, Hermione, you're right. Godric's Hollow holds a special significance for me. It's where it all began, where my parents lived and died. And now, I have this strong feeling that I need to go back there. Plus, I can visit my parents' graves, pay my respects. It's something I feel compelled to do."
「Harry, did you ever even open A History of Magic?」

「Erm, I might’ve opened it, you know, when I bought it . . . just the once. . . . But that's not the point, Hermione. I need to find out more about Bathilda Bagshot and her connection to my parents. It could be a clue to understanding their past and maybe even finding the rest of the letter.」
「“Harry, what if Bathilda’s got the sword? What if Dumbledore entrusted it to her?”」
"Yeah, he might have done! So, are we going to go to Godric’s Hollow?"
「Correct,」
「Yeah, it was alright. Spent most of it with my family. How about you?」
「Same here, spent time with the Weasleys.What's going on?」
「Hi, Good holiday?」
"Not bad, thanks. How about you?"
「Hi, Hagrid.」
「What’ve you done to him?」
「Oh . . . um . . . okay.」
「Hermione, what's going on? Why did Umbridge just attack Magorian?」

「We’re going out. Sorry? We — that is to say, your aunt, Dudley, and I — are going out. Fine. You are not to leave your bedroom while we are away. Okay. You are not to touch the television, the stereo, or any of our possessions. Right. You are not to steal food from the fridge. Okay. I am going to lock your door. You do that.」
「Fine, I won't leave my bedroom or touch anything. Just make sure you don't bring any more of your dreadful guests into the house while you're gone.」
「Snape’s right, though, isn’t he? I dunno whether it’s worth me taking the test. I just can’t get the hang of Apparition.」

「You might as well do the extra practice sessions in Hogsmeade and see where they get you. It’ll be more interesting than trying to get into a stupid hoop anyway. Then, if you’re still not — you know — as good as you’d like to be, you can postpone the test, do it with me over the summer.」

「Oh, It’s you two, Who were you expecting?, Nobody, He said he’d come back and see me, but then you said you’d pop in and visit me too — she gave Harry a reproachful look — and I haven’t seen you for months and months. I’ve learned not to expect too much from boys.」
「I thought you lived in that girls’ bathroom?, I do, but that doesn’t mean I can’t visit other places. I came and saw you in your bath once, remember?, Vividly.」
「Harry, I’m sorry, I’m so sorry!」
"Don't be sorry, Hermione. It's not your fault. We're in this together, remember? We'll figure it out. We always do."
「Anyway — Harry, a very happy birthday to yeh. Got summat fer yeh here — I mighta sat on it at some point, but it’ll taste all right.」
「Thanks, but I'm not really hungry right now.」
「You stay where you are!」
"Alright, alright, no need to get your wand in a twist. I was just trying to be helpful. But if you insist, I'll stay put."
「That was the one you nearly swallowed!」
"Yeah, I remember. It was a close call, but luckily I managed to catch it in time. Thanks for reminding me, Ron."
「“And the sword, Why did he want Harry to have the sword?”」

「We’ve lost the trail. C’mon, let’s go and find them.」
「Speaking of centaurs, who’s Divination teacher now? Is Firenze staying?」
「He’s got to, the other centaurs won’t take him back, will they?」
「It looks like he and Trelawney are both going to teach.」
「Bet Dumbledore wishes he could’ve got rid of Trelawney for good. Mind you, the whole subject’s useless if you ask me, Firenze isn’t a lot better . . .」
「How can you say that? After we’ve just found out that there are real prophecies?」
「Well, I suppose Firenze is a bit more open-minded than the rest of them. But Divination is still a tricky subject, isn't it?」

「Harry think "Harry’s heart began to race. He had not told Ron, Hermione, or anyone else what the prophecy had contained. Neville had told them it had smashed while Harry was pulling him up the steps in the Death Room, and Harry had not yet corrected this impression. He was not ready to see their expressions when he told them that he must be either murderer or victim, there was no other way. . . ."」

*takes a deep breath* "Listen, everyone, there's something I need to tell you. The prophecy... it wasn't destroyed. It's about me. It says that either I have to kill Voldemort or he'll kill me. There's no other way around it. I didn't want to burden you all with this, but now you need to know the truth."
*gasps* "Harry, why didn't you tell us before?"

"I wasn't ready, Hermione. It's a lot to take in, and I didn't want to put you all in danger. But now, we have to face the reality of it. We have to find a way to stop Voldemort and fulfill the prophecy."
*serious expression* "We're with you, mate. We've faced dangerous situations before, and we'll face this one together. We'll figure out a plan and make sure you come out of this alive."
*determined* "Harry, you've always been there for us. Now it's our turn to be there for you. We'll fight alongside you, no matter what."
*grateful smile* "Thank you, all of you. Your support means everything to me. We'll need to be strong and united. Together, we can overcome anything."

「Winky is still drinking lots, sir. She still does not care for clothes, Harry Potter. Nor do the other house-elves. None of them will clean Gryffindor Tower anymore, not with the hats and socks hidden everywhere, they finds them insulting, sir. Dobby does it all himself, sir, but Dobby does not mind, sir, for he always hopes to meet Harry Potter and tonight, sir, he has got his wish! But Harry Potter does not seem happy, Dobby went on, straightening up again and looking timidly at Harry. Dobby heard him muttering in his sleep. Was Harry Potter having bad dreams? Not really bad, said Harry, yawning and rubbing his eyes. I’ve had worse. The elf surveyed Harry out of his vast, orblike eyes. Then he said very seriously, his ears drooping, Dobby wishes he could help Harry Potter, for Harry Potter set Dobby free and Dobby is much, much happier now . . . You can’t help me, Dobby, but thanks for the offer . . . He bent and picked up his Potions book. He’d have to try and finish the essay tomorrow. He closed the book and as he did so the firelight illuminated the thin white scars on the back of his hand — the result of his detention with Umbridge. Wait a moment — there is something you can do for me, Dobby, said Harry slowly. The elf looked around, beaming. Name it, Harry Potter, sir! I need to find a place where twenty-eight people can practice Defense Against the Dark Arts without being discovered by any of the teachers. Especially, Harry clenched his hand on the book, so that the scars shone pearly white, Professor Umbridge. He expected the elf’s smile to vanish, his ears to droop; he expected him to say that this was impossible, or else that he would try, but his hopes were not high. . . . What he had not expected was for Dobby to give a little skip, his ears waggling happily, and clap his hands together. Dobby knows the perfect place, sir! he said happily. Dobby heard tell of it from the other house-elves when he came to Hogwarts, sir. It is known by us as the Come and Go Room, sir, or else as the Room of Requirement! Why? said Harry curiously. Because it is a room that a person can only enter, said Dobby seriously, when they have real need of it. Sometimes it is there, and sometimes it is not, but when it appears, it is always equipped for the seeker’s needs. Dobby has used it, sir, said the elf, dropping his voice and looking guilty, when Winky has been very drunk. He has hidden her in the Room of Requirement and he has found antidotes to butterbeer there, and a nice elf-sized bed to settle her on while she sleeps it off, sir. . . . And Dobby knows Mr. Filch has found extra cleaning materials there when he has run short, sir, and — — and if you really needed a bathroom, said Harry, suddenly remembering something Dumbledore had said at the Yule Ball the previous Christmas, would it fill itself with chamber pots? Dobby expects so, sir, said Dobby, nodding earnestly. It is a most amazing room, sir. How many people know about it? said Harry, sitting up straighter in his chair. Very few, sir. Mostly people stumbles across it when they needs it, sir, but often they never finds it again, for they do not know that it is always there waiting to be called into service, sir. It sounds brilliant, said Harry, his heart racing. It sounds perfect, Dobby. When can you show me where it is? Anytime, Harry Potter, sir, said Dobby, looking delighted at Harry’s enthusiasm. We could go now, if you like! For a moment Harry was tempted to go now; he was halfway out of his seat, intending to hurry upstairs for his Invisibility Cloak when, not for the first time, a voice very much like Hermione’s whispered in his ear」

「Wait, Dobby. As much as I appreciate your offer, we should plan this properly. We don't want to risk getting caught. Let's meet tomorrow night, and you can show me the Room of Requirement then. We'll gather everyone who needs to practice Defense Against the Dark Arts and make sure we're prepared. Thank you, Dobby, for your help. I really appreciate it.」
「Professor McGonagall action」
「Mr. Potter, what are you doing?」
「I'm trying to retrieve my Remembrall, Professor. Malfoy took it from me.」
「Mr. Malfoy, return Mr. Potter's Remembrall immediately.」
「But Professor, I found it. It's mine now.」
「That is not how things work here, Mr. Malfoy. Give it back this instant or face the consequences.」
「Fine, take your stupid Remembrall.」
「Thank you, Professor.」
「You're welcome, Mr. Potter. Now, let's all focus on our flying lesson.」

「Hmm, Looks like something’s attacked her. Can’t think what would have done it, though. . . . Thestrals will sometimes go for birds, of course, but Hagrid’s got the Hogwarts thestrals well trained not to touch owls . . .」
「Hagrid's thestrals wouldn't harm owls, so it must have been something else. We need to find out what attacked her and make sure it doesn't happen again.」
「Do you know how far this owl’s traveled, Potter?」
「From London, I think.」
「Just a moment, Wilhelmina! Potter’s letter!」
「Yes, Professor McGonagall?」
「Where did you take her?」
「To the Chamber of Secrets.」
「What do we do?」

「Well, we don't have a choice, do we? We have to do it ourselves. We'll gather all the information we can, practice the spells, and support each other. We'll become our own Defense Against the Dark Arts teachers. It won't be easy, but it's the only way we can prepare ourselves for what's to come. We've faced challenges before, and we've always found a way to overcome them. We'll do the same this time. Together.」
「Death Eater think "bawling loudly, flailing arms dangerously"」
"What's going on? Where am I?"
「Dolohov toppled forward across his comrade, rigid as a board」
「Expelliarmus!」
Harry's spell hit Dolohov and his wand flew out of his hand
「Dat’s a pulse, Harry, I’b sure id is . . .」
「She’s alive?」
「And whad are you going do do?」
"I'm going to make sure you pay for what you've done to him. You won't get away with hurting my friend like this. I'll do whatever it takes to protect him and make things right."

「His powers, as you heard, were surprisingly well-developed for such a young wizard and — most interestingly and ominously of all — he had already discovered that he had some measure of control over them, and begun to use them consciously. And as you saw, they were not the random experiments typical of young wizards」
「But what does that have to do with the prophecy?」

「The prophecy speaks of a power that the Dark Lord knows not, and you have shown time and again that love is a power that he cannot comprehend. It is not just any love, Harry, but your capacity to love deeply and selflessly, even in the face of great adversity. It is this love that sets you apart and gives you the strength to face Voldemort.」
「So, love is the power that will defeat him?」

「Love is a powerful force, Harry, but it is not the only power that will defeat Voldemort. It is your courage, your resilience, and your unwavering determination to protect those you care about that will ultimately lead to his downfall. Love is merely a part of the equation, albeit a crucial one.」
「“I’ve got all the robes I want,” said Ron.」
「“Well, I didn’t think it would be necessary to bring them,” said Ron, looking slightly sheepish. “I mean, we’re only going to Hagrid’s, aren’t we?”」
「Harry, well done! You did it, you found out how all by yourself!」
「Well, yeah, I guess I did figure it out. But it was a team effort, Hermione. We couldn't have done it without you and Ron.」
「’Cause I reckon, if he can talk ter people, he’ll understand more that we all like him really, an’ want him to stay . . .」
「That's right, Hagrid. We care about you and we care about Grawp. We want to help you both.」
「We’ll . . .」
「We’ll make it work. We always do.」
「“He cheeked me.”」
「Yeah? Did he say you look like a pig that’s been taught to walk on its hind legs? ’Cause that’s not cheek, Dud, that’s true . . .」
「“You’re not allowed,” Dudley said at once. “I know you’re not. You’d get expelled from that freak school you go to.”」
「Oh, yeah? Try me.」
「Yeah, go on . . .」
"I reckon we should stick together and keep an eye out for any signs of trouble. We've faced worse things than this, haven't we? We'll be alright as long as we stick together and stay focused."
「Can you?」
「I can try.」
「You’ve got a rubbish sense of humor then」
「Well, it’s no joke, Ron. That bite looks nasty. You should really take care of it.」
「You don’t think he’s . . . hurt, or anything, do you?」
「I don't think so, Hermione. It's just the scar acting up. But we should keep an eye on him, just to be safe.」
「Who’s that?」
"That's Luna Lovegood. She's a bit... eccentric, but she's a good friend."
「Give ’em a lifelong siesta, I would,」

"Well, Uncle Vernon, I can understand your frustration, but I don't think wishing for someone to have a lifelong siesta is the solution. Besides, we should be more concerned about the strange occurrences happening around us rather than harboring ill-will towards others. It's important to stay vigilant and be prepared for any unexpected events that may come our way."
「Harry running to keep up with them」

「You can speak Parseltongue, Harry, because Lord Voldemort — who is the last remaining descendant of Salazar Slytherin — can speak Parseltongue. Unless I’m much mistaken, he transferred some of his own powers to you the night he gave you that scar. Not something he intended to do, I’m sure. . . .」
「So you're saying that Voldemort unintentionally transferred some of his powers to me when he tried to kill me?」
「Yes, that seems to be the case. It appears that a part of Voldemort's own abilities, including the ability to speak Parseltongue, was passed on to you through the connection formed that night.」
「But why would he do that?」

「I believe it was an unintended consequence of his failed attempt to kill you. Voldemort's soul fragment latched onto your own, granting you certain powers and abilities. It was not something he planned or desired, but rather a result of the extraordinary circumstances surrounding that event.」
「It certainly seems so.」
「But what can we do? How can we stop him?」

「“This is your final warning,” said Umbridge’s soft voice, magically magnified so that it sounded clearly over the man’s desperate screams. “If you struggle, you will be subjected to the Dementor’s Kiss.”」
「No! You can't do that to him! It's inhumane!」
「“Next — Mary Cattermole,” called Umbridge.」

「Narrator think "And how did the mysterious Ariana die? Was she the inadvertent victim of some Dark rite? Did she stumble across something she ought not to have done, as the two young men sat practicing for their attempt at glory and domination? Is it possible that Ariana Dumbledore was the first person to die “for the greater good”?"」

「I don't know, but I don't think it was a Dark rite or something they were practicing. It's a painful memory for my family, and I don't like to dwell on it. Ariana's death was a tragedy, and it deeply affected my brother and me. We've always wondered what really happened, but we may never know the full truth. All we can do is remember her and honor her memory.」
「What — what happened? Harry? Why are we in here? Where’s Sirius? Where’s Lupin? What’s going on?」

「Madam Pomfrey, I'm sorry for the commotion. We were just trying to find answers and help Sirius and Professor Lupin. We discovered a hidden chamber and encountered some strange events. We need to find them and make sure they're safe. Can you please tell us what you know?」
「Yeah . . . can’t’ve tied him up properly. I was worried this mornin’, mind . . . thought he mighta met Professor Lupin on the grounds, but Lupin says he never ate anythin’ las’ night. . . .」
「What?」
「I’ll explain later, I’ve got to hurry, I’m supposed to be at the meeting — I’ll just show you where you’re sleeping.」
「Mrs. Weasley, why — ?」
「Ron and Hermione will explain everything, dear, I’ve really got to dash.」
「She’s been in a right state, Pecked us half to death when she brought your last letters, look at this —」
「Sorry about that, but I wanted answers, you know . . .Have either of you been attacked by dementors this summer?」
「He was so angry. Dumbledore. We saw him. When he found out Mundungus had left before his shift had ended. He was scary.」
「Well, I’m glad he left. If he hadn’t, I wouldn’t have done magic and Dumbledore would probably have left me at Privet Drive all summer.」
「She’s been in a right state, Pecked us half to death when she brought your last letters, look at this —」
「Sorry about that, but I wanted answers, you know . . .」
「He was so angry. Dumbledore. We saw him. When he found out Mundungus had left before his shift had ended. He was scary.」
「Well, I’m glad he left. If he hadn’t, I wouldn’t have done magic and Dumbledore would probably have left me at Privet Drive all summer.」
「Ah, don’t say that, Dirk.」
「Sorry, but we're in a bit of a hurry. We need to find the real sword of Gryffindor.」
「If somebody swapped the real sword for the fake while it was in Dumbledore’s office, Phineas Nigellus would have seen it happen, he hangs right beside the case!」
「Unless he was asleep.」
「'Please' always helps.」
「Sorry, Professor Black, but it's a necessary precaution!」
「Remove this foul addition at once! Remove it, I say! You are ruining a great work of art! Where am I? What is going on?」
「Never mind where we are.」
「Remove this foul addition at once! Remove it, I say! You are ruining a great work of art! Where am I? What is going on?」
「Never mind where we are. What matters is that you listen to what I have to say.」
「I will not listen to a mere student! I demand to be released immediately!」
「You may not want to hear it, but it concerns you directly. It's about the true ownership of the sword of Gryffindor.」
「What nonsense are you spouting? The sword belongs to the true heir of Godric Gryffindor, and that is Severus Snape!」
「No, it doesn't. The sword was never Snape's. It was a fake that was placed in Dumbledore's office. The real sword was taken by someone else.」
「Preposterous! How dare you accuse the esteemed Professor Snape of such deceit!」
「I have evidence to support my claim. The person who took the real sword was under the Imperius Curse, controlled by Draco Malfoy's father.」
「Absurd! I will not entertain these baseless accusations. Release me at once!」
「I understand your skepticism, but I assure you, this is the truth. We need your help to uncover the truth and set things right.」
「Why would Snape do somethin’ like that?」
「I found out something about him, Hagrid. He tried to get past that three-headed dog on Halloween. It bit him. We think he was trying to steal whatever it’s guarding.」
「How do you know about Fluffy?」
「Hagrid, we overheard someone talking about it. Please, we need your help. We think something bad is going to happen involving the Philosopher's Stone.」
「I do feel so sorry for all those people who have to stay at Hogwarts for Christmas because they’re not wanted at home.」

「Well, Malfoy, some of us actually enjoy spending the holidays at Hogwarts. It's a time for friends, feasts, and magical festivities. We don't need to pity ourselves just because we have a different kind of family.」
「If you’ll follow me, Mr. Potter, I’ve already taken your things up. . . .」
「Thanks, Tom. I appreciate it.」
「Very smart owl you’ve got there, Arrived about five minutes after you did. If there’s anything you need, Mr. Potter, don’t hesitate to ask.」
「Thanks, Tom. Actually, I was wondering if you've seen Winky around? I heard she's been having a tough time lately.」
「Dumbledore think "I guessed, fifteen years ago, when I saw the scar upon your forehead, what it might mean. I guessed that it might be the sign of a connection forged between you and Voldemort."」
「So you knew about the connection between me and Voldemort all along?」
「I had strong suspicions, Harry. But it was not until your fourth year at Hogwarts that I had the confirmation I needed.」
「And you didn't tell me because...?」
「I wanted to protect you, Harry. I knew that Voldemort would stop at nothing to use you for his own gain. I wanted to ensure that you were prepared and had the necessary knowledge to face him.」
「Yes,」
「But why? Why did you trust Snape?」

「Room eleven’s free, Harry. I think you’ll be very comfortable. Just one thing, and I’m sure you’ll understand . . . I don’t want you wandering off into Muggle London, all right? Keep to Diagon Alley. And you’re to be back here before dark each night. Sure you’ll understand. Tom will be keeping an eye on you for me.」
「Alright, I understand. I'll stay in Diagon Alley and be back before dark. Thanks for looking out for me, Tom.」
「Well, I’ll be off, plenty to do, you know. . . .」
「Wait, Minister! Can I ask you something?」
「Certainly, Harry. What is it?」
「Have you had any luck with capturing Sirius Black yet?」
「Ah, No, no, I’m very sorry, Harry, but as I’m not your parent or guardian —」
「But you're the Minister of Magic! You have the authority to make exceptions, don't you? This is a matter of life and death! Sirius Black is after me, and I need to protect myself!」
「Thank you, Harry,」
「You're welcome, Lupin. I'm honored to be chosen as Teddy's godfather. I'll do my best to be there for him, just like my godfather was for me.」
「Well . . . it’s just that Dobby’s plans aren’t always that safe. Don’t you remember when he lost you all the bones in your arm?」
「I remember, Hermione. But Dobby has helped us before, and I trust him. We need all the help we can get right now.」
「Dumbledore told you about it?」
「No, he didn't. But I know Snape, and I know Malfoy. Something's not right. I can feel it.」

「And just look at these books! A Compendium of Common Curses and Their Counter-Actions . . . The Dark Arts Outsmarted . . . Self-Defensive Spellwork . . . wow . . . Harry, this is wonderful, there’s everything we need here!」

「Yeah, it's pretty amazing, isn't it? We've got all the resources we need to learn and defend ourselves. We'll be unstoppable with these books. Let's make the most of it and study hard, Hermione. We need to be prepared for whatever comes our way.」
「Harry, there’s got to be a thousand Galleons in here.」
「Yeah, Think how many Canary Creams that is.」
「Just don’t tell your mum where you got it . . . although she might not be so keen for you to join the Ministry anymore, come to think of it. . . .」
「Fred stared at him.」
"What's the matter, Fred? You look like you've seen a ghost."
「Are you seventeen, then?」
"Yeah, I turned seventeen a few months ago. Can't believe we're finally of age, mate."
「What’re we going to do today, then?」

"Well, Ron, I was thinking we could go down to the Quidditch pitch and have a practice session. It's been a while since we've had a chance to fly, and I could use some practice on my Seeker skills. What do you think?"
「What is it with her?」
「I don't know, Ron. She seems a bit off today. Maybe something's bothering her. We should check on her and see if she's alright.」

「Oh dear, dear, dear, I was counting on you, Harry! Well, now, I’ll just have to have a word with Severus and explain the situation. I’m sure I’ll be able to persuade him to postpone your detention. Yes, I’ll see you both later!」
"I'm afraid that won't work, Professor Slughorn. Snape won't be persuaded to postpone my detention. He did it once for Dumbledore, but he won't do it for anyone else."
「Hermione anxiously」
「What are we going to do?」
「But how can he have done, Harry? We were all searched when we arrived, weren’t we?」

「I don't know, Hermione. Maybe he found a way to smuggle it in without being detected. We know Hagrid has a way with magical creatures, so perhaps he used one of them to hide whatever he's keeping in there. We'll have to find a way to get a closer look and figure it out.」
「I think Mum thinks that if she can stop the three of you getting together and planning, she’ll be able to delay you leaving,」

And then what does she think’s going to happen? Someone else might kill off Voldemort while she’s holding us here making vol-au-vents? So it’s true? That’s what you’re trying to do? I — not — I was joking.
「So it’s true? That’s what you’re trying to do?」

「I — not — I was joking.Look, Ginny, I can't just sit around and do nothing while Voldemort is out there, causing harm and spreading fear. I have to do whatever it takes to stop him. It's not about seeking attention or glory, it's about protecting the people I care about and standing up against evil.」

「Mr. Weasley think "Well, Mad-Eye set up a couple of curses against Snape in case he turns up there again. We hope they’ll be strong enough both to keep him out and to bind his tongue if he tries to talk about the place, but we can’t be sure. It would have been insane to keep using the place as headquarters now that its protection has become so shaky,"」
「No news about Mad-Eye?And they still haven’t called a hearing about all the underage magic I used escaping the Death Eaters?」
「I can act from here,」
「I understand, Professor. Thank you for your help.」
「— Protego Horribilis — the diadem of Ravenclaw? A little extra wisdom never goes amiss, Potter, but I hardly think it would be much use in this situation!」
「I only meant — do you know where it is? Have you ever seen it?」

「Bad news, Harry. I’ve just been to see Professor McGonagall about the Firebolt. She — er — got a bit shirty with me. Told me I’d got my priorities wrong. Seemed to think I cared more about winning the Cup than I do about you staying alive. Just because I told her I didn’t care if it threw you off, as long as you caught the Snitch first. Honestly, the way she was yelling at me . . . you’d think I’d said something terrible. . . . Then I asked her how much longer she was going to keep it. . . . I reckon it’s time you ordered a new broom, Harry. There’s an order form at the back of Which Broomstick . . . you could get a Nimbus Two Thousand and One, like Malfoy’s got.」

「I’m not buying anything Malfoy thinks is good.No, Wood, you can’t have it back yet. We need to ensure it's safe. Professor Flitwick suspects it may be carrying a Hurling Hex. I'll let you know once we've finished checking it. Please be patient and stop badgering me about it.To make matters even worse, my anti-dementor lessons aren't going as well as I had hoped. My Patronus is still too feeble to drive the dementors away. It's frustrating, but I need to remind myself that even producing an indistinct Patronus is a significant achievement for a thirteen-year-old wizard. I shouldn't be too hard on myself.」
「You can’t Apparate inside the Hogwarts grounds, how often do I have to tell you?」
「I know, Hermione, but I can't just sit here while Sirius Black is out there. I need to find him, I need to know the truth.」
「We wrote to James three times a week last year.」
「And you don’t want to believe everything he tells you about Hogwarts. He likes a laugh, your brother.」
「“I think Harry’s right,” said Hermione quietly.」
「Thanks, Hermione. I appreciate your support.」
「Er — I’m sorry — I don’t understand you.」
"That's alright, sir. I was just wondering if you could tell me more about the incident involving the Gaunt family and Tom Riddle."
「Yes, of course. Why can’t Ogden — ?」
「No, sir, I mean what I saw in the Pensieve. I saw Malfoy showing Borgin something, and then he threatened Borgin. And then I saw Snape . . .」
「Yes, I am aware of what you saw, Harry.」
「But don’t you see, sir? Malfoy is up to something, and Snape is involved!」
「I understand your concerns, Harry, but we must exercise caution. It is not wise to jump to conclusions without sufficient evidence.」
「But what if Malfoy is planning something dangerous? We can't just ignore it!」

「I assure you, Harry, that I am keeping a close watch on Malfoy and Snape. If there is any imminent danger, we will take appropriate action. For now, focus on your own tasks and trust that I am handling the situation.」
「has anyone actually seen Kreacher lately?」
「I haven’t seen him since the night we came back here, You were ordering him out of the kitchen.」
「You know, I think that’s the last time I saw him, too. . . . He must be hiding upstairs somewhere . . .」
「He couldn’t have left, could he? I mean, when you said ‘out,’ maybe he thought you meant, get out of the house?」
「You know, I think that’s the last time I saw him, too. . . . He must be hiding upstairs somewhere . . .」
「I haven’t seen him since the night we came back here, You were ordering him out of the kitchen.」

「That’s an understatement. They’re raking in the Galleons! I can’t wait to see the place, we haven’t been to Diagon Alley yet, because Mum says Dad’s got to be there for extra security and he’s been really busy at work, but it sounds excellent.」
「And what about Percy? Is he talking to your mum and dad again?」
「Nope.」
「But he knows your dad was right all along now about Voldemort being back —He’s going to be giving me private lessons this year.」
「Blimey . . . private lessons with Dumbledore! I wonder why he’s . . . ?」
「I don’t know exactly why he’s going to be giving me lessons, but I think it must be because of the prophecy.」
「Nope.」
「Well, it’s not like I haven’t noticed your little crush on her.」
「Blimey . . . private lessons with Dumbledore! I wonder why he’s . . . ?」
「I don’t know exactly why he’s going to be giving me lessons, but I think it must be because of the prophecy.」
「Precisely.」
「Thanks, Fat Lady. You always know how to make me feel better.」
「Overindulged over Christmas, apparently, She and her friend Violet drank their way through all the wine in that picture of drunk monks down by the Charms corridor. Anyway . . .」

「Sounds like they had quite the festive celebration. I hope they didn't cause too much trouble. Anyway, let's go grab that butterbeer at the Three Broomsticks. It's always a good way to celebrate Christmas.」
「No, I can’t. So don’t even ask.」
